intro: Onychium kholianum, commonly known as the Kholian's onychium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
